definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: We last saw the boy playing nearby the river bank.
sentences.chinese: 本人們比來還看到阿誰小男孩在河濱玩。

sentences.english: On a hot day there's nothing I like more than a cold orange juice.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得，大熱天沒有比來杯橘子汁更過癮的了。

sentences.english: And, for that, we use the Jacobian.
We can therefore, flexibly change the spectrum resolution by changing the decimation factor.
sentences.chinese: 可以靈活地改變選抽比來改變譜的分辨率。

sentences.english: Vietnam than to take the bride expensive?
This makes clear in core international needs to rely on enough gain of one-time earnings ability recently.
sentences.chinese: 這剖明中芯國際比來需要依靠一次性收益才能夠盈利。

sentences.english: what you thought before you got here.
sentences.chinese: 變得比來這裏之前的你更優秀。

sentences.english: 'I can't say I'm more  optimistic than I was before coming here,' Mr. Juncker added later.
sentences.chinese: 容克後來又說，我不能說我比來這裏之前更加樂觀了。

sentences.english: Why do critics insist on comparing one artist with another?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼評論家們總是把藝術家們比來比去？

sentences.english: Recently, we've been in the studio working with Japanese pop star Jin Akanishi.
sentences.chinese: 比來，我們和日本流行明星赤西仁在事變室錄音。
